intro: Piptadenia amazonica, commonly known as the Amazonian copal tree, is a deciduous tree native to the Amazon rainforest. It belongs to the Fabaceae family and is characterized by its compound leaves and yellow flowers. The plant produces a resinous gum that has been traditionally used by indigenous communities. It thrives in tropical climates with high humidity and well-drained soils. Its ecological role includes providing habitat and food for various wildlife species.
